abstract: County clerk Kim Davis in Morehead, Ky, refuses to issue marriage licenses to gay couples, citing her Christian beliefs and defying both order from court and from Gov Steven L Beshear; Morehead is one of few remaining pockets of official resistance to gay marriage across country, and case is legal test of how far official can go in defying Supreme Court decision affirming gay marriage.
lead_paragraph: The Rowan County clerk, Kim Davis, has said her Christian faith bars her from authorizing same-sex marriages and has refused to issue any licenses, either to same-sex or heterosexual couples.

headline.main: Kentucky Clerk Defies Court on Marriage Licenses for Gay Couples
headline.print_headline: Kentucky Clerk’s Defiance Tests Boundaries of Gay Marriage Ruling

snippet: The Rowan County clerk, Kim Davis, has said her Christian faith bars her from authorizing same-sex marriages and has refused to issue any licenses, either to same-sex or heterosexual couples.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
